game

Class DifficultGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Screen
      • game.LevelScreen
        • game.DifficultGame

  • public class DifficultGame
extends LevelScreen
    The DifficultGame class represents the screen for the difficult level. The gameplay involves shooting anions (negative ions) at cations (positive ions) and vice versa to create ionic compounds. All charges can be matched up exactly.
    Version:
    1.0, May 31 2014. (Creates the game with difficult particles. No win/game over screen), 1.1, June 2 2014. (Full JavaDoc), 1.2, June 3 2014. (Modifications due to location class constructor change, removes instead of sets location to null, two keys at once), 1.3, June 4 2014. (Added win and lose screens), 1.4, June 5 2014. (Added more targets and inventory, current JavaDoc), 1.5, June 8 2014. (Added absorbers), 2.0, June 8 2014. (Displays facts.), 2.1, June 10 2014. (JavaDoc), 2.2, June 11 2014. (Fixed win screen)
    Author:
    Anqi Wu

    • Constructor Detail

      • DifficultGame

        public DifficultGame(ScreenFactory screenFactory)
        Constructs a difficult level screen. This creates a random list of targets and inventory with charges from -3 to +3.
        Parameters:
        screenFactory - - ScreenFactory - The ScreenFactory object that stores the current screen.
        newTargets - - ArrayList - Stores the temporary targets.
        newInventory - - ArrayList - Stores the temporary inventory.
        name - - String - Stores the temporary names of the elements.
        charge - - int - Stores the temporary charge of the element.
        count - - int - Stores the number of charge 1/-1 elements.
        count2 - - int - Stores the number of charge 2/-2 elements.
        count3 - - int - Stores the number of charge 3/-3 elements.
        element - - int - Stores the temporary index of the current element.
        row - - int - Stores the current row of the location to set for the elements.
        col - - int - Stores the current column of the location to set for the elements.

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate()
        Empty override from the Screen class.
        Specified by:
        onCreate in class LevelScreen

      • onUpdate

        public void onUpdate()
        First, the player and shooting is updated. Then, target-inventory interaction is updated. If there is any target in the same location as an inventory particle, interaction has occurred. Either both are removed or only one is removed, depending on whether the user shot at the correct target. Points are also updated. 10 points are added if the charges add to 0. 5 points are deducted if they do not add to 0. Finally, all elements with no locations are removed, and all elements are updated.
        Specified by:
        onUpdate in class LevelScreen
        Parameters:
        index - - int - Stores the index of the target at the same location as the current inventory.
        index2 - - int - Stores the index of the obstacle at the same location as the current inventory.
        dart - - GameParticle - Stores the temporary element to be shot with.
        x - - int - Increments through for loop.
        inv - - GameParticle - Stores the temporary inventory elements.
        tar - - GameParticle - Stores the temporary target elements.

      • getObstacleIndex

        public int getObstacleIndex(Location location)
        Returns the obstacle at the location in the parameter. It returns null if not found.
        Parameters:
        location - - Location - The location of the obstacle to find.
        x - - int - Increments through for loop.
        Returns:
        An int that represents the index of the obstacle.

      • win

        public void win(java.awt.Graphics2D twoDimensional)
        Draws the win screen. The game loses focus, so the user cannot move the launcher.
        Parameters:
        twoDimensional - - Graphics2D - The Graphics2D object.

      • onDraw

        public void onDraw(java.awt.Graphics2D twoDimensional)
        Displays the difficult level on the Panel. It draws the wallpaper, player (launcher), inventory and targets, respectively. If the inventory and targets are all removed, and the game has not been won before, the win screen is displayed. Otherwise, if only the inventory is used up, the gameOver screen is displayed.
        Overrides:
        onDraw in class LevelScreen
        Parameters:
        twoDimensional - - Graphics2D - The Graphics2D object.
        x - - int - Increments through for loop.
